home.intro-subheadline: to contribute to the carbon transition and have an impact on the climate?
home.section0-text:
Using the algorithm we developed, we analysed the offer of courses and training in higher education in Belgium (universities and higher education schools).

Our analysis reveals that more than 60% of programmes do not include any courses that deal with climate and environmental issues, and that only 5% of the courses deal with these subjects. Moreover, the training offer is very segregated and concentrated mainly in the sciences and applied sciences.

Finally, a survey we conducted among a sample of students revealed that more than 87% of them would like to be trained in these issues.

In view of this observation, we propose avenues of reflection to support the transition and adaptation of higher education training.

Download the report
For the moment only available in French and Dutch, an English version will soon be available.
home.section1-text:
Environmental sustainability is a major concern for all citizens, especially for students. The transition towards a carbon neutral society in 2050 decided by the European Union not only requires massive investments and changes in industry, services and infrastructures, but also skills to drive the ecological shift.

In Belgium, universities and higher education schools have a special role to play to educate future executives and key players to the climate and environmental challenges. Therefore, we advocate for their integration in every curricula.
home.section2-text:
The Education4Climate website enables you to find courses, and curricula that cover climate and environmental sustainability, as well as the professors who teach these subjects, in Belgium.

The Education4Climate website relies on an automated algorithm that analyses the content of the pages of the courses published on the universities’s websites, to identify those covering climate and environmental sustainability. A description of the algorithm can be found here.
home.section3-text:
Education4Climate aims at promoting education about climate and environmental sustainability in universities and higher education schools. Its target is to facilitate the access to information on the curricula and courses that address these subjects, make data driven analysis of the education offering, and propose concrete solutions, to be found in our report.

Education4Climate is driven by a team of volunteers from The Shifters Belgium, with the mentoring of the SDSN Belgium, The Shift and The Shift Project.

Want to know more or contribute? Please contact us!
home.section4-text: Continuous improvement of Education4Climate is our priority. If you would like to flag a course or a curricula, or suggest improvements, you can do it via our form.

report.intro-headline: Mobilising post-secondary education for the transition to carbon neutrality
report.intro-subheadline: Preparing future graduates for climate and environmental issues in Belgian universities and higher education schools
report.button-subtitle: This document is an interim report with restricted circulation, its final version is planned for 8 May 2022. We invite you to read it and to send us your remarks and observations before March 1st by contacting us by email.
report.section1-text:
Young people are demonstrating en masse for the climate in Belgium and around the world.
The European Union has set itself an ambitious target of carbon neutrality by 2050. This requires not only significant investments, but also knowledge and skills.

In view of this, Education4Climate conducted a survey to understand students' expectations and analysed the range of courses and training on climate and environmental issues in Belgian universities and higher education schools.
The results are published in the report "Mobilising higher education for the transition to carbon neutrality".
report.section2-text:
Education4Climate was born out of the conviction that universities and higher education schools have a special role to play in educating the citizens, decision-makers and talent that our society and businesses need to meet the challenge of the transition to carbon neutrality and sustainability.

This is why Education4Climate advocates for the integration of climate and environmental education in as many courses as possible and proposes solutions to achieve this goal.

How the algorithm works

The Education4Climate project works through an algorithm whose objective is to identify which courses and programs at each school and university cover certain themes related to climate and environmental sustainability. A more detailed description of the methodology can be found here.

The purpose of this data processing is to list on our site, for information purposes, the courses and programs that deal with issues related to the climate and the energy transition. The purpose of this project is therefore to increase the visibility of these courses and their teachers.
